an2.48:1: "Bhikkhus, there are these two kinds of assemblies. What two? The assembly that values worldly things, not the good Dhamma, and the assembly that values the good Dhamma, not worldly things.[n.286]Mp:"That values worldly things(āmisagaru): one that values the four requisites and regards the world-transcending Dhamma as inferior.That values the good Dhamma(saddhammagaru): one that values the nine world-transcendingdhammas(the four paths, four fruits, and nibbāna), and regards the four requisites as inferior."
